page.title: 11Thirsk Singers
page.content: Thirsk Singers have been around for 8 years. They used to be called Thirsk Madrigal Group but they now sing a much wider range of songs including folk songs, Beatles songs, Vivaldi's Gloria (accompanied by an orchestra) and also songs composed by Mr.Wilson, who is a member of the choir. There are 2O members - 6 sopranos, 4 contraltos, 5 tenors and 5 bass.The ladies wear red skirts and cream blouses. Men wear dark suits. The oldest member is now 75 years old whilst the youngest is 25. They sing all over the area. They have lately sung at many public houses raising money for Ethiopia. Sometimes they sing at churches, chapels, local halls such as Sutton Hall and soon they will be singing at Fountains Abbey in the autumn.{Claire Chapman
